parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired pitch actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired roll actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_Y_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired yaw actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_PR_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain.

parameter.name: FW_PR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_PR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_RLL_TO_YAW_FF
parameter.short_desc: Roll control to yaw control feedforward gain
parameter.long_desc: This gain can be used to counteract the "adverse yaw" effect for fixed wings. When the plane enters a roll it will tend to yaw the nose out of the turn. This gain enables the use of a yaw actuator to counteract this effect.

parameter.name: FW_RR_D
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: FW_RR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output. Use this to obtain a tigher response of the controller without introducing noise amplification.

parameter.name: FW_RR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameter.name: FW_SPOILERS_MAN
parameter.long_desc: Chose source for manual setting of spoilers in manual flight modes.

parameter.name: FW_YR_D
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: FW_YR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command. Further, if the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively. Has to be set according to the vehicle's stall speed (which should be set in FW_AIRSPD_STALL), with some margin between the stall speed and minimum airspeed. This value corresponds to the desired minimum speed with the default load factor (level flight, default weight), and is automatically adpated to the current load factor (calculated from roll setpoint and WEIGHT_GROSS/WEIGHT_BASE).

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_STALL
parameter.long_desc: The stall airspeed (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. It is used for airspeed sensor failure detection and for the control surface scaling airspeed limits.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: The trim CAS (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. If an airspeed controller is active, this is the default airspeed setpoint that the controller will try to achieve.

parameter.name: FW_GND_SPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The controller will increase the commanded airspeed to maintain this minimum groundspeed to the next waypoint.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximum pitch angle setpoint setpoint for a height-rate or altitude controlled mode.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimum pitch angle setpoint for a height-rate or altitude controlled mode.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ASPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle for level flight at maximum airspeed FW_AIRSPD_MAX (sea level, standard atmosphere) Set to 0 to disable mapping of airspeed to trim throttle.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ASPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Required throttle for level flight at minimum airspeed FW_AIRSPD_MIN (sea level, standard atmosphere) Set to 0 to disable mapping of airspeed to trim throttle below FW_AIRSPD_TRIM.

parameter.name: FW_THR_IDLE
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground For aircraft with internal combustion engines, this parameter should be set above the desired idle rpm. For electric motors, idle should typically be set to zero. Note that in automatic modes, "landed" conditions will engage idle throttle.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For overpowered aircraft, this should be reduced to a value that provides sufficient thrust to climb at the maximum pitch angle PTCH_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For electric aircraft this will normally be set to zero, but can be set to a small non-zero value if a folding prop is fitted to prevent the prop from folding and unfolding repeatedly in-flight or to provide some aerodynamic drag from a turning prop to improve the descent rate. For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set for desired idle rpm.

parameter.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameter.name: FW_THR_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve FW_AIRSPD_TRIM during level flight.

parameter.name: FW_TKO_AIRSPD
parameter.long_desc: The calibrated airspeed setpoint TECS will stabilize to during the takeoff climbout. If set <= 0.0, FW_AIRSPD_MIN will be set by default.

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the trim value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced.

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_R_SP
parameter.long_desc: The default rate at which the vehicle will climb in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes this defines the maximum rate at which the altitude setpoint can be increased.

parameter.name: FW_T_I_GAIN_PIT
parameter.long_desc: This is the integrator gain on the pitch part of the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.

parameter.name: FW_T_I_GAIN_THR
parameter.long_desc: This is the integrator gain on the throttle part of the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.

parameter.name: FW_T_PTCH_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.

parameter.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

parameter.name: FW_T_SEB_R_FF
parameter.short_desc: Specific total energy balance rate feedforward gain

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_R_SP
parameter.long_desc: The default rate at which the vehicle will sink in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes this defines the maximum rate at which the altitude setpoint can be decreased.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Set to 2 for gliders.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_DEV_STD
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed rate measurement standard deviation for airspeed filter
parameter.long_desc: This is the measurement standard deviation for the airspeed rate used in the airspeed filter in TECS.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_PRC_STD
parameter.short_desc: Process noise standard deviation for the airspeed rate in the airspeed filter
parameter.long_desc: This is the process noise standard deviation in the airspeed filter filter defining the noise in the airspeed rate for the constant airspeed rate model. This is used to define how much the airspeed and the airspeed rate are filtered. The smaller the value the more the measurements are smoothed with the drawback for delays.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_STD
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed measurement standard deviation for airspeed filter
parameter.long_desc: This is the measurement standard deviation for the airspeed used in the airspeed filter in TECS.

parameter.name: FW_T_STE_R_TC
parameter.short_desc: Specific total energy rate first order filter time constant
parameter.long_desc: This filter is applied to the specific total energy rate used for throttle damping.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

parameter.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in m/s/s) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameter.name: FW_WIND_ARSP_SC
parameter.long_desc: Multiplying this factor with the current absolute wind estimate gives the airspeed offset added to the minimum airspeed setpoint limit. This helps to make the system more robust against disturbances (turbulence) in high wind. Only applies to AUTO flight mode. airspeed_min_adjusted = FW_AIRSPD_MIN + FW_WIND_ARSP_SC * wind.length()

parameter.name: FD_ACT_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that for motors, a minimum amount of ESC current per throttle level is being consumed. Otherwise this indicates an motor failure.

parameter.name: FD_ACT_MOT_C2T
parameter.long_desc: Motor failure triggers only below this current value

parameter.name: FD_ACT_MOT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Motor failure triggers only above this throttle value.

parameter.name: FD_ACT_MOT_TOUT
parameter.long_desc: Motor failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time.

parameter.name: FD_ESCS_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable checks on ESCs that report their arming state
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the ESCs have successfully armed when the vehicle has transitioned to the armed state. Timeout for receiving an acknowledgement from the ESCs is 0.3s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle.

parameter.name: FD_EXT_ATS_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable PWM input on for engaging failsafe from an external automatic trigger system (ATS)
parameter.long_desc: Enabled on either AUX5 or MAIN5 depending on board. External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameter.name: FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG
parameter.short_desc: The PWM threshold from external automatic trigger system for engaging failsafe
parameter.long_desc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_P
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_P_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_R
parameter.long_desc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_R_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.

parameter.name: FD_IMB_PROP_THR
parameter.long_desc: Value at which the imbalanced propeller metric (based on horizontal and vertical acceleration variance) triggers a failure Setting this value to 0 disables the feature.

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_ALT_M
parameter.long_desc: Maintain altitude or track target's altitude. When maintaining the altitude, the drone can crash into terrain when the target moves uphill. When tracking the target's altitude, the follow altitude FLW_TGT_HT should be high enough to prevent terrain collisions due to GPS inaccuracies of the target.

values.value: 2D Tracking: Maintain constant altitude relative to home and track XY position only
2D + Terrain: Maintain constant altitude relative to terrain below and track XY position
3D Tracking: Track target's altitude (be aware that GPS altitude bias usually makes this useless)

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_DST
parameter.long_desc: The distance in meters to follow the target at

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_FA
parameter.long_desc: Angle to follow the target from. 0.0 Equals straight in front of the target's course (direction of motion) and the angle increases in clockwise direction, meaning Right-side would be 90.0 degrees while Left-side is -90.0 degrees Note: When the user force sets the angle out of the min/max range, it will be wrapped (e.g. 480 -> 120) in the range to gracefully handle the out of range.

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_HT
parameter.long_desc: Following height above the target

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_MAX_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum tangential velocity setting for generating the follow orbit trajectory
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum tangential velocity the drone will circle around the target whenever an orbit angle setpoint changes. Higher value means more aggressive follow behavior.

parameter.name: FLW_TGT_RS
parameter.short_desc: Responsiveness to target movement in Target Estimator
parameter.long_desc: lower values increase the responsiveness to changing position, but also ignore less noise

parameter.name: GPS_1_GNSS
parameter.short_desc: GNSS Systems for Primary GPS (integer bitmask)
parameter.long_desc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS

parameter.name: GPS_1_PROTOCOL
parameter.long_desc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.

parameter.name: GPS_2_GNSS
parameter.short_desc: GNSS Systems for Secondary GPS (integer bitmask)
parameter.long_desc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS

parameter.name: GPS_2_PROTOCOL
parameter.long_desc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.

parameter.name: GPS_DUMP_COMM
parameter.long_desc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message. If this is set to 2, the main GPS is configured to output RTCM data, which is then logged as gps_dump and can be used for PPK.

parameter.name: GPS_PITCH_OFFSET
parameter.short_desc: Pitch offset for dual antenna GPS
parameter.long_desc: Vertical offsets can be compensated for by adjusting the Pitch offset (Septentrio). Note that this can be interpreted as the "roll" angle in case the antennas are aligned along the perpendicular axis. This occurs in situations where the two antenna ARPs may not be exactly at the same height in the vehicle reference frame. Since pitch is defined as the right-handed rotation about the vehicle Y axis, a situation where the main antenna is mounted lower than the aux antenna (assuming the default antenna setup) will result in a positive pitch.

parameter.name: GPS_SAT_INFO
parameter.long_desc: Enable publication of satellite info (ORB_ID(satellite_info)) if possible. Not available on MTK.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_BAUD2
parameter.long_desc: Select a baudrate for the F9P's UART2 port. In GPS_UBX_MODE 1, 2, and 3, the F9P's UART2 port is configured to send/receive RTCM corrections. Set this to 57600 if you want to attach a telemetry radio on UART2.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL
parameter.long_desc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Select the u-blox configuration setup. Most setups will use the default, including RTK and dual GPS without heading. If rover has RTCM corrections from a static base (or other static correction source) coming in on UART2, then select Mode 5. The Heading mode requires 2 F9P devices to be attached. The main GPS will act as rover and output heading information, whereas the secondary will act as moving base. Modes 1 and 2 require each F9P UART1 to be connected to the Autopilot. In addition, UART2 on the F9P units are connected to each other. Modes 3 and 4 only require UART1 on each F9P connected to the Autopilot or Can Node. UART RX DMA is required. RTK is still possible with this setup.

values.value: Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Moving Base)
Moving Base (UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Rover)
Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
Moving Base (Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
Rover with Static Base on UART2 (similar to Default, except coming in on UART2)

parameter.name: GPS_YAW_OFFSET
parameter.short_desc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameter.long_desc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the rover (or Unicore primary) antenna is in front. The offset angle increases clockwise. Set this to 90 if the rover (or Unicore primary) antenna is placed on the right side of the vehicle and the moving base antenna is on the left side. (Note: the Unicore primary antenna is the one connected on the right as seen from the top).

parameter.name: PPS_CAP_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: Enables the PPS capture module. This switches mode of FMU channel 7 to be the PPS input channel.

parameter.name: GF_ACTION
parameter.long_desc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence.

parameter.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: Select which altitude (AMSL) source should be used for geofence calculations.

values.value: Raw barometer altitude (assuming standard atmospheric pressure)

parameter.name: GF_COUNT
parameter.long_desc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameter.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameter.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameter.name: GF_PREDICT
parameter.long_desc: Predict the motion of the vehicle and trigger the breach if it is determined that the current trajectory would result in a breach happening before the vehicle can make evasive maneuvers. The vehicle is then re-routed to a safe hold position (stop for multirotor, loiter for fixed wing).

parameter.name: GF_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameter.name: HTE_ACC_GATE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: HTE_HT_ERR_INIT
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: HTE_HT_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Reduce to make the hover thrust estimate more stable, increase if the real hover thrust is expected to change quickly over time.

parameter.name: HTE_THR_RANGE
parameter.long_desc: Defines the range of the hover thrust estimate around MPC_THR_HOVER. A value of 0.2 with MPC_THR_HOVER at 0.5 results in a range of [0.3, 0.7]. Set to a large value if the vehicle operates in varying physical conditions that affect the required hover thrust strongly (e.g. differently sized payloads).

parameter.name: HTE_VXY_THR
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal velocity threshold for sensitivity reduction
parameter.long_desc: Above this speed, the measurement noise is linearly increased to reduce the sensitivity of the estimator from biased measurement. Set to a low value on vehicles with large lifting surfaces.

parameter.name: HTE_VZ_THR
parameter.short_desc: Vertical velocity threshold for sensitivity reduction
parameter.long_desc: Above this speed, the measurement noise is linearly increased to reduce the sensitivity of the estimator from biased measurement. Set to a low value on vehicles affected by air drag when climbing or descending.

parameter.name: ISBD_READ_INT
parameter.short_desc: Satellite radio read interval. Only required to be nonzero if data is not sent using a ring call

parameter.name: ISBD_STACK_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Time the Iridium driver will wait for additional mavlink messages to combine them into one SBD message
parameter.long_desc: Value 0 turns the functionality off

parameter.name: LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state

parameter.name: LNDFW_TRIG_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Time the land conditions (speeds and acceleration) have to be satisfied to detect a landing.

parameter.name: LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max horizontal velocity threshold
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state. A factor of 0.7 is applied in case of airspeed-less flying (either because no sensor is present or sensor data got invalid in flight).

parameter.name: LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max vertiacal velocity threshold
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state.

parameter.name: LNDFW_XYACC_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max horizontal acceleration
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal (x,y body axes) acceleration allowed in the landed state

parameter.name: LNDMC_ALT_GND
parameter.long_desc: The height above ground below which ground effect creates barometric altitude errors. A negative value indicates no ground effect.

parameter.name: LNDMC_ALT_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The system will obey this limit as a hard altitude limit. This setting will be consolidated with the GF_MAX_VER_DIST parameter. A negative value indicates no altitude limitation.

parameter.name: LNDMC_ROT_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum allowed angular velocity around each axis allowed in the landed state.

parameter.name: LNDMC_TRIG_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Total time it takes to go through all three land detection stages: ground contact, maybe landed, landed when all necessary conditions are constantly met.

parameter.name: LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state

parameter.name: LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Vertical velocity threshold to detect landing. Has to be set lower than the expected minimal speed for landing, which is either MPC_LAND_SPEED or MPC_LAND_CRWL. This is enforced by an automatic check.

parameter.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_HI
parameter.long_desc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Higher 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameter.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_LO
parameter.long_desc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Lower 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameter.name: LTEST_SENS_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X Position of IRLOCK in body frame (forward)

parameter.name: LTEST_SENS_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y Position of IRLOCK in body frame (right)

parameter.name: LTEST_SENS_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z Position of IRLOCK in body frame (downward)

parameter.name: LTEST_SENS_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of IRLOCK sensor relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: Default orientation of Yaw 90°

parameter.name: LTEST_ACC_UNC
parameter.long_desc: Variance of acceleration measurement used for landing target position prediction. Higher values results in tighter following of the measurements and more lenient outlier rejection

parameter.name: LTEST_MEAS_UNC
parameter.long_desc: Variance of the landing target measurement from the driver. Higher values result in less aggressive following of the measurement and a smoother output as well as fewer rejected measurements.

parameter.name: LTEST_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Configure the mode of the landing target. Depending on the mode, the landing target observations are used differently to aid position estimation. Mode Moving: The landing target may be moving around while in the field of view of the vehicle. Landing target measurements are not used to aid positioning. Mode Stationary: The landing target is stationary. Measured velocity w.r.t. the landing target is used to aid velocity estimation.

parameter.name: LTEST_POS_UNC_IN
parameter.long_desc: Initial variance of the relative landing target position in x and y direction

parameter.name: LTEST_SCALE_X
parameter.short_desc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor x axis
parameter.long_desc: Landing target x measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameter.name: LTEST_SCALE_Y
parameter.short_desc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor y axis
parameter.long_desc: Landing target y measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameter.name: LTEST_VEL_UNC_IN
parameter.long_desc: Initial variance of the relative landing target velocity in x and y directions

parameter.name: LPE_ACC_XY
parameter.long_desc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz) Larger than data sheet to account for tilt error.

parameter.name: LPE_ACC_Z
parameter.long_desc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz)

parameter.name: LPE_BAR_Z
parameter.short_desc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation

parameter.name: LPE_EPH_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max EPH allowed for GPS initialization

parameter.name: LPE_EPV_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max EPV allowed for GPS initialization

parameter.name: LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN
parameter.short_desc: Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow)
parameter.long_desc: By initializing the estimator to the LPE_LAT/LON parameters when global information is unavailable

parameter.name: LPE_FGYRO_HP
parameter.short_desc: Flow gyro high pass filter cut off frequency

parameter.name: LPE_FLW_OFF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow z offset from center

parameter.name: LPE_FLW_RR
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow angular velocity noise gain

parameter.name: LPE_FUSION
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to fuse GPS data if available, also requires GPS for altitude init 1 : Set to true to fuse optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to fuse vision position 3 : Set to true to enable landing target 4 : Set to true to fuse land detector 5 : Set to true to publish AGL as local position down component 6 : Set to true to enable flow gyro compensation 7 : Set to true to enable baro fusion default (145 - GPS, baro, land detector)

bitmask.bit: fuse GPS, requires GPS for alt. init

parameter.name: LPE_GPS_VXY
parameter.long_desc: EPV used if greater than this value.

parameter.name: LPE_GPS_XY
parameter.short_desc: Minimum GPS xy standard deviation, uses reported EPH if greater

parameter.name: LPE_GPS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Minimum GPS z standard deviation, uses reported EPV if greater

parameter.name: LPE_LAND_VXY
parameter.short_desc: Land detector xy velocity standard deviation

parameter.name: LPE_LAT
parameter.short_desc: Local origin latitude for nav w/o GPS

parameter.name: LPE_LDR_OFF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Lidar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameter.name: LPE_LON
parameter.short_desc: Local origin longitude for nav w/o GPS

parameter.name: LPE_LT_COV
parameter.short_desc: Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater

parameter.name: LPE_PN_P
parameter.long_desc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameter.name: LPE_PN_T
parameter.short_desc: Terrain random walk noise density, hilly/outdoor (0.1), flat/Indoor (0.001)

parameter.name: LPE_PN_V
parameter.long_desc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameter.name: LPE_SNR_OFF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Sonar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameter.name: LPE_T_MAX_GRADE
parameter.short_desc: Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg)
parameter.long_desc: Used to calculate increased terrain random walk nosie due to movement.

parameter.name: LPE_VIS_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: Set to zero to enable automatic compensation from measurement timestamps

parameter.name: LPE_VXY_PUB
parameter.short_desc: Required velocity xy standard deviation to publish position

parameter.name: LPE_Z_PUB
parameter.short_desc: Required z standard deviation to publish altitude/ terrain

parameter.name: MAV_FWDEXTSP
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 incoming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode

parameter.name: MAV_HASH_CHK_EN
parameter.long_desc: Disabling the parameter hash check functionality will make the mavlink instance stream parameters continuously.

parameter.name: MAV_HB_FORW_EN
parameter.long_desc: The mavlink heartbeat message will not be forwarded if this parameter is set to 'disabled'. The main reason for disabling heartbeats to be forwarded is because they confuse dronekit.

values.value: Default to 1, switch to 2 if GCS sends version 2

parameter.name: MAV_RADIO_TOUT
parameter.short_desc: Timeout in seconds for the RADIO_STATUS reports coming in
parameter.long_desc: If the connected radio stops reporting RADIO_STATUS for a certain time, a warning is triggered and, if MAV_X_RADIO_CTL is enabled, the software-flow control is reset.

parameter.name: MAV_SIK_RADIO_ID
parameter.long_desc: When non-zero the MAVLink app will attempt to configure the SiK radio to this ID and re-set the parameter to 0. If the value is negative it will reset the complete radio config to factory defaults. Only applies if this mavlink instance is going through a SiK radio

values.value: VTOL Standard (separate fixed rotors for hover and cruise flight)

parameter.name: MAV_USEHILGPS
parameter.short_desc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message even if not in HIL mode
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 incoming HIL GPS messages are parsed.

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_BAUD
parameter.long_desc: Default rate is 250Kbps, which is used in off-the-shelf MoadalAI ESC products.

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Selects what type of UART ESC, if any, is being used.

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Selects what type of mode is enabled, if any

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_RPM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum RPM for ESC

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_RPM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum RPM for ESC

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_SDIR1
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC ID 1 Spin Direction Flag

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_SDIR2
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC ID 2 Spin Direction Flag

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_SDIR3
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC ID 3 Spin Direction Flag

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_SDIR4
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC ID 4 Spin Direction Flag

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_T_DEAD
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC Turtle Mode Crash Flip Motor Deadband

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_T_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC Turtle Mode Crash Flip Motor expo

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_T_MINF
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC Turtle Mode Crash Flip Motor STICK_MINF

parameter.name: MODAL_IO_T_PERC
parameter.short_desc: UART ESC Turtle Mode Crash Flip Motor Percent

parameter.name: MBE_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: This enables continuous calibration of the magnetometers before takeoff using gyro data.

parameter.name: MBE_LEARN_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: Increase to make the estimator more responsive Decrease to make the estimator more robust to noise

parameter.name: MAN_ARM_GESTURE
parameter.long_desc: This determines if moving the left stick to the lower right arms and to the lower left disarms the vehicle.

parameter.name: FW_GPSF_LT
parameter.long_desc: The time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for GPS recovery before it starts descending. Set to 0 to disable. Roll angle is set to FW_GPSF_R. Does only apply for fixed-wing vehicles or VTOLs with NAV_FORCE_VT set to 0.

parameter.name: FW_GPSF_R
parameter.long_desc: Roll in degrees during the loiter after the vehicle has lost GPS in an auto mode (e.g. mission or loiter).

parameter.name: MIS_DIST_1WP
parameter.short_desc: Maximal horizontal distance from current position to first waypoint
parameter.long_desc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIST_1WP from the current position.

parameter.name: MIS_LND_ABRT_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Minimum altitude above landing point that the vehicle will climb to after an aborted landing. Then vehicle will loiter in this altitude until further command is received. Only applies to fixed-wing vehicles.

parameter.name: MIS_MNT_YAW_CTL
parameter.short_desc: Enable yaw control of the mount. (Only affects multicopters and ROI mission items)
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, yaw commands will be sent to the mount and the vehicle will follow its heading towards the flight direction. If disabled, the vehicle will yaw towards the ROI.

parameter.name: MIS_PD_TO
parameter.short_desc: Timeout for a successful payload deployment acknowledgement

parameter.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum altitude the system will take off to.

parameter.name: MIS_TKO_LAND_REQ
parameter.long_desc: Specifies if a mission has to contain a takeoff and/or mission landing. Validity of configured takeoffs/landings is checked independently of the setting here.

values.value: Require a takeoff and a landing
Require both a takeoff and a landing, or neither

parameter.name: MIS_YAW_ERR
parameter.short_desc: Max yaw error in degrees needed for waypoint heading acceptance

parameter.name: MIS_YAW_TMT
parameter.short_desc: Time in seconds we wait on reaching target heading at a waypoint if it is forced
parameter.long_desc: If set > 0 it will ignore the target heading for normal waypoint acceptance. If the waypoint forces the heading the timeout will matter. For example on VTOL forwards transition. Mainly useful for VTOLs that have less yaw authority and might not reach target yaw in wind. Disabled by default.

parameter.name: MPC_YAW_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Specifies the heading in Auto.

parameter.name: NAV_ACC_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set. For fixed wing the npfg switch distance is used for horizontal acceptance.

parameter.name: NAV_FORCE_VT
parameter.short_desc: Force VTOL mode takeoff and land

parameter.name: NAV_FW_ALTL_RAD
parameter.short_desc: FW Altitude Acceptance Radius before a landing
parameter.long_desc: Altitude acceptance used for the last waypoint before a fixed-wing landing. This is usually smaller than the standard vertical acceptance because close to the ground higher accuracy is required.

parameter.name: NAV_FW_ALT_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Acceptance radius for fixedwing altitude.

parameter.name: NAV_LOITER_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, Hold mode, Return mode, etc. (fixedwing only).

parameter.name: NAV_MC_ALT_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Acceptance radius for multicopter altitude.

parameter.name: NAV_MIN_LTR_ALT
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum altitude above Home the system will always obey in Loiter (Hold) mode if switched into this mode without specifying an altitude (e.g. through Loiter switch on RC). Doesn't affect Loiters that are part of Missions or that are entered through a reposition setpoint ("Go to"). Set to a negative value to disable.

parameter.name: NAV_TRAFF_AVOID
parameter.long_desc: Enabling this will allow the system to respond to transponder data from e.g. ADSB transponders

parameter.name: NAV_TRAFF_A_HOR
parameter.short_desc: Set NAV TRAFFIC AVOID horizontal distance
parameter.long_desc: Defines a crosstrack horizontal distance

parameter.name: NAV_TRAFF_A_VER
parameter.short_desc: Set NAV TRAFFIC AVOID vertical distance

parameter.name: NAV_TRAFF_COLL_T
parameter.long_desc: Minimum acceptable time until collsion. Assumes constant speed over 3d distance.

parameter.name: WEIGHT_BASE
parameter.long_desc: This is the weight of the vehicle at which it's performance limits were derived. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameter.name: WEIGHT_GROSS
parameter.long_desc: This is the actual weight of the vehicle at any time. This value will differ from WEIGHT_BASE in case weight was added or removed from the base weight. Examples are the addition of payloads or larger batteries. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameter.name: MC_AIRMODE
parameter.long_desc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.

parameter.name: MNT_DO_STAB
parameter.long_desc: Set to true for servo gimbal, false for passthrough. This is required for a gimbal which is not capable of stabilizing itself and relies on the IMU's attitude estimation.

parameter.name: MNT_MAN_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary channel to control pitch (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameter.name: MNT_MAN_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary channel to control roll (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameter.name: MNT_MAN_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary channel to control yaw (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameter.name: MNT_MAV_COMPID
parameter.short_desc: Mavlink Component ID of the mount
parameter.long_desc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLink protocol v2, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this component ID.

parameter.name: MNT_MAV_SYSID
parameter.short_desc: Mavlink System ID of the mount
parameter.long_desc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLink gimbal protocol v1, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this target ID.

parameter.name: MNT_MODE_IN
parameter.long_desc: This is the protocol used between the ground station and the autopilot. Recommended is Auto, RC only or MAVLink gimbal protocol v2. The rest will be deprecated.

values.value: Auto (RC and MAVLink gimbal protocol v2)

parameter.name: MNT_MODE_OUT
parameter.long_desc: This is the protocol used between the autopilot and a connected gimbal. Recommended is the MAVLink gimbal protocol v2 if the gimbal supports it.

parameter.name: MNT_OFF_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Offset for pitch channel output in degrees

parameter.name: MNT_OFF_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Offset for roll channel output in degrees

parameter.name: MNT_OFF_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Offset for yaw channel output in degrees

parameter.name: MNT_RANGE_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Range of pitch channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_RANGE_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Range of roll channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_RANGE_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Range of yaw channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_RATE_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Angular pitch rate for manual input in degrees/second
parameter.long_desc: Full stick input [-1..1] translats to [-pitch rate..pitch rate].

parameter.name: MNT_RATE_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Angular yaw rate for manual input in degrees/second
parameter.long_desc: Full stick input [-1..1] translats to [-yaw rate..yaw rate].

parameter.name: MNT_RC_IN_MODE
parameter.short_desc: Input mode for RC gimbal input

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for pitch rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameter.name: MC_PITCH_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for roll rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameter.name: MC_ROLL_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_WEIGHT
parameter.long_desc: A fraction [0,1] deprioritizing yaw compared to roll and pitch in non-linear attitude control. Deprioritizing yaw is necessary because multicopters have much less control authority in yaw compared to the other axes and it makes sense because yaw is not critical for stable hovering or 3D navigation. For yaw control tuning use MC_YAW_P. This ratio has no impact on the yaw gain.

parameter.name: MPC_YAWRAUTO_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max yaw rate in auto mode
parameter.long_desc: Limit the rate of change of the yaw setpoint in autonomous mode to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameter.name: CP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Average delay of the range sensor message plus the tracking delay of the position controller in seconds
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: CP_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidance is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value

parameter.name: CP_GO_NO_DATA
parameter.short_desc: Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: CP_GUIDE_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint by which the collision prevention algorithm can choose to change the setpoint direction
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: MC_MAN_TILT_TAU
parameter.short_desc: Manual tilt input filter time constant
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_DOWN_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes down

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_HOR
parameter.short_desc: Acceleration for auto and for manual
parameter.long_desc: Note: In manual, this parameter is only used in MPC_POS_MODE 4.

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal acceleration for auto mode and for manual mode
parameter.long_desc: MPC_POS_MODE 1 just deceleration 3 acceleration and deceleration 4 just acceleration

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_UP_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes upward

parameter.name: MPC_ALT_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to control height relative to the earth frame origin. This origin may move up and down in flight due to sensor drift. Set to 1 to control height relative to estimated distance to ground. The vehicle will move up and down with terrain height variation. Requires a distance to ground sensor. The height controller will revert to using height above origin if the distance to ground estimate becomes invalid as indicated by the local_position.distance_bottom_valid message being false. Set to 2 to control height relative to ground (requires a distance sensor) when stationary and relative to earth frame origin when moving horizontally. The speed threshold is controlled by the MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY parameter.

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Deadzone of sticks where position hold is enabled

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_Z
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameter.name: MPC_JERK_AUTO
parameter.long_desc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility.

parameter.name: MPC_JERK_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility (how fast it can change directions or break). Setting this to the maximum value essentially disables the limit. Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to a smoothing mode 3 or 4.

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_ALT1
parameter.short_desc: Altitude for 1. step of slow landing (descend)
parameter.long_desc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to a value between "MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN" (or "MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN") and "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be higher than "MPC_LAND_ALT2"

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_ALT2
parameter.short_desc: Altitude for 2. step of slow landing (landing)
parameter.long_desc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be lower than "MPC_LAND_ALT1"

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_ALT3
parameter.short_desc: Altitude for 3. step of slow landing
parameter.long_desc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_CRWL", if LIDAR available. No effect if LIDAR not available

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_CRWL
parameter.long_desc: Used below MPC_LAND_ALT3 if distance sensor data is availabe.

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_RADIUS
parameter.long_desc: When user assisted descent is enabled (see MPC_LAND_RC_HELP), this parameter controls the maximum position adjustment allowed from the original landing point.

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_RC_HELP
parameter.short_desc: Enable user assisted descent for autonomous land routine
parameter.long_desc: When enabled, descent speed will be: stick full up - 0 stick centered - MPC_LAND_SPEED stick full down - 2 * MPC_LAND_SPEED Additionally, the vehicle can be yawed and moved laterally using the other sticks. Manual override during auto modes has to be disabled to use this feature (see COM_RC_OVERRIDE).

parameter.name: MPC_MANTHR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. With MC_AIRMODE set to 1, this can safely be set to 0.

parameter.name: MPC_MAN_TILT_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximal tilt angle in manual or altitude mode

parameter.name: MPC_MAN_Y_TAU
parameter.short_desc: Manual yaw rate input filter time constant
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter

parameter.name: MPC_POS_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The supported sub-modes are: 0 Simple position control where sticks map directly to velocity setpoints without smoothing. Useful for velocity control tuning. 3 Smooth position control with maximum acceleration and jerk limits based on jerk optimized trajectory generator (different algorithm than 1). 4 Smooth position control where sticks map to acceleration and there's a virtual brake drag

parameter.name: MPC_THR_CURVE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines how the throttle stick input is mapped to commanded thrust in Manual/Stabilized flight mode. In case the default is used ('Rescale to hover thrust'), the stick input is linearly rescaled, such that a centered stick corresponds to the hover throttle (see MPC_THR_HOVER). Select 'No Rescale' to directly map the stick 1:1 to the output. This can be useful in case the hover thrust is very low and the default would lead to too much distortion (e.g. if hover thrust is set to 20%, 80% of the upper thrust range is squeezed into the upper half of the stick range). Note: In case MPC_THR_HOVER is set to 50%, the modes 0 and 1 are the same.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_HOVER
parameter.long_desc: Vertical thrust required to hover. This value is mapped to center stick for manual throttle control. With this value set to the thrust required to hover, transition from manual to Altitude or Position mode while hovering will occur with the throttle stick near center, which is then interpreted as (near) zero demand for vertical speed. This parameter is also important for the landing detection to work correctly.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum thrust in auto thrust control
parameter.long_desc: Limit max allowed thrust

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum collective thrust in auto thrust control
parameter.long_desc: It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. Note: Without airmode zero thrust leads to zero roll/pitch control authority. (see MC_AIRMODE)

parameter.name: MPC_THR_XY_MARG
parameter.long_desc: Margin that is kept for horizontal control when prioritizing vertical thrust. To avoid completely starving horizontal control with high vertical error.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_AIR
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_LND
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameter.name: MPC_TKO_RAMP_T
parameter.short_desc: Position control smooth takeoff ramp time constant
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this value will make automatic and manual takeoff slower. If it's too slow the drone might scratch the ground and tip over. A time constant of 0 disables the ramp

parameter.name: MPC_USE_HTE
parameter.long_desc: Set false to use the fixed parameter MPC_THR_HOVER Set true to use the value computed by the hover thrust estimator

parameter.name: MPC_VELD_LP
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cut freq. for numerical velocity derivative

parameter.name: MPC_VEL_MANUAL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity setpoint in Position mode
parameter.long_desc: If velocity setpoint larger than MPC_XY_VEL_MAX is set, then the setpoint will be capped to MPC_XY_VEL_MAX The maximum sideways and backward speed can be set differently using MPC_VEL_MAN_SIDE and MPC_VEL_MAN_BACK, respectively.

parameter.name: MPC_VEL_MAN_BACK
parameter.short_desc: Maximum backward velocity in Position mode
parameter.long_desc: If set to a negative value or larger than MPC_VEL_MANUAL then MPC_VEL_MANUAL is used.

parameter.name: MPC_VEL_MAN_SIDE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum sideways velocity in Position mode
parameter.long_desc: If set to a negative value or larger than MPC_VEL_MANUAL then MPC_VEL_MANUAL is used.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: Horizontal velocity used when flying autonomously in e.g. Missions, RTL, Goto.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_ERR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal error allowed by the trajectory generator
parameter.long_desc: The integration speed of the trajectory setpoint is linearly reduced with the horizontal position tracking error. When the error is above this parameter, the integration of the trajectory is stopped to wait for the drone. This value can be adjusted depending on the tracking capabilities of the vehicle.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_MAN_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Manual position control stick exponential curve sensitivity
parameter.long_desc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MPC_XY_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_TRAJ_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal trajectory position error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_ALL
parameter.long_desc: If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as MPC_XY_VEL_MAX or MPC_VEL_MANUAL). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_D_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again
parameter.long_desc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_I_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameter.long_desc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non-zero value allows to eliminate steady state errors in the presence of disturbances like wind.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode. If higher speeds are commanded in a mission they will be capped to this velocity.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_P_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error
parameter.long_desc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_YAW_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Manual control stick yaw rotation exponential curve
parameter.long_desc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MPC_Z_MAN_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Manual control stick vertical exponential curve
parameter.long_desc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MPC_Z_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_ALL
parameter.long_desc: If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP or MPC_LAND_SPEED). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_D_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_I_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN
parameter.long_desc: Descent velocity in manual modes and offboard. For auto modes, see MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP
parameter.long_desc: Ascent velocity in manual modes and offboard. For auto modes, see MPC_Z_V_AUTO_UP

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_P_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN
parameter.long_desc: Descent velocity in auto modes. For manual modes and offboard, see MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN

parameter.name: MPC_Z_V_AUTO_UP
parameter.long_desc: Ascent velocity in auto modes. For manual modes and offboard, see MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP

parameter.name: SYS_VEHICLE_RESP
parameter.long_desc: Changes the overall responsiveness of the vehicle. The higher the value, the faster the vehicle will react. If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as the acceleration or jerk limits). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.

parameter.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameter.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode Expo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameter.long_desc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode Expo factor for Yaw
parameter.long_desc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_P_MAX
parameter.long_desc: default: 2 turns per second

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_R_MAX
parameter.long_desc: default: 2 turns per second

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPO
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameter.long_desc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 reasonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPOY
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Yaw
parameter.long_desc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 reasonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameter.long_desc: default 1.5 turns per second

parameter.name: MC_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameter.long_desc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The copter should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max acceleration at lower battery percentages. i.e. if hover is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_K
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_PITCHRATE_K * (MC_PITCHRATE_P * error + MC_PITCHRATE_I * error_integral + MC_PITCHRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_PITCHRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_PITCHRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_PR_INT_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large pitch moment trim changes.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_K
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_ROLLRATE_K * (MC_ROLLRATE_P * error + MC_ROLLRATE_I * error_integral + MC_ROLLRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_ROLLRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_ROLLRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_RR_INT_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large roll moment trim changes.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_K
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_YAWRATE_K * (MC_YAWRATE_P * error + MC_YAWRATE_I * error_integral + MC_YAWRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_YAWRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_YAWRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_YR_INT_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large yaw moment trim changes.

parameter.name: OSD_ATXXXX_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure the ATXXXX OSD Chip (mounted on the OmnibusF4SD board) and select the transmission standard.

parameter.name: MOT_SLEW_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Minimum motor rise time (slew rate limit)
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through a range of 1000 PWM units. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 1000 to 2000 PWM in minimum x seconds. Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: PWM_SBUS_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable S.BUS version 1 output instead of RSSI.

parameter.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameter.short_desc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
parameter.long_desc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.

parameter.name: PLD_BTOUT
parameter.long_desc: Time after which the landing target is considered lost without any new measurements.

parameter.name: PLD_FAPPR_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Allow final approach (without horizontal positioning) if losing landing target closer than this to the ground.

parameter.name: PLD_HACC_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Start descending if closer above landing target than this.

parameter.name: PLD_MAX_SRCH
parameter.long_desc: Maximum number of times to search for the landing target if it is lost during the precision landing.

parameter.name: PLD_SRCH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude above home to which to climb when searching for the landing target.

parameter.name: PLD_SRCH_TOUT
parameter.long_desc: Time allowed to search for the landing target before falling back to normal landing.

parameter.name: RC10_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC10_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC10_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC10_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC10_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC11_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC11_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC11_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC11_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC11_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC12_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC12_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC12_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC12_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC12_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC13_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC13_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC13_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC13_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC13_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC14_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC14_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC14_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC14_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC14_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC15_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC15_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC15_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC15_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC15_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC16_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC16_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC16_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC16_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC16_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC17_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC17_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC17_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC17_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC17_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC18_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC18_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC18_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameter.name: RC18_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC18_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.name: RC1_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC1_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for RC channel 1

parameter.name: RC1_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for RC channel 1

parameter.name: RC1_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC1_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value

parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
